item.title: The Pokémon Theme Park’s First Trailer Still Doesn’t Explain Anything
item.content:encoded:
Back in July this year, Nintendo held a spectactularly bad Pokémon Presents, during which close to nothing was announced but for a shambolic reveal that there was going to be a new Pokémon theme park opening in 2026 called PokéPark Kanto. The announcement treated us to images of cheap, plastic Pokémon toys balanced on a table. Someone used the words “where Pokémon truly exist” to describe the supposed wonders of this place, while we saw fiberglass Pokémon put near some trees. It was amazing. Anyway, jump forward four months and an official opening date has been announced, along with a video showing…animated people visiting an animated park?

I am very here for this ongoing weirdness. Part of me wishes it could all turn out to be some Willy Wonka Experience-type fiasco, eventually opening on February 5 to reveal a bleak, near-empty warehouse with a few 3D-printed Pokémon toys and a lady wearing a yellow tracksuit and face paint telling crying children that she’s Pikachu. I realize, given this is The Pokémon Company (and therefore Nintendo), that’s not enormously likely. But it sure is being marketed like it should be! The park itself will be a part of an enormous theme park in Tokyo called Yomiuriland, and is described as “the first ever permanent Pokémon outdoor facility.”

But first, that Direct footage is still making me laugh months later:

And now we can add to it a superbly made animated trailer for the park that—because it’s an animated trailer that leans into the fantasy of the place—tells us literally nothing concrete or useful whatsoever. I’m going to go out on a limb and argue that The Pokémon Company has not successfully conducted some sort of gruesome genetic modification program and successfully bred real-world Pokémon to populate their park, so I suspect that we can at the very least reject the bit where there are Eevee and Pikachu scampering down the paths, or terrifying stampedes of Rhydon and Onyx as Pidgeo fly overheard. I am, however, willing to suspend my disbelief enough to accept that something a lot like Rattata might be present.

OK, so let’s be fair; the website for the park does show some proof of existence, albeit very sparse. Among a lot of cartoon images we have what look like real-life photographs of a Pokémon Center, a Poké Mart and a Gym. And then, bizarrely, the same photographs of fiberglass Eevee that we saw back in July.

So don’t get me wrong. I would hop from foot to foot in gleeful excitement if I were able to go into a real, actual, full-size Pokémon Center, where I assume I would meet Nurse Joy herself. But again, I’m getting abandoned park vibes before this place even opens.

There are to be three sections: Sedge Town, Pokémon Forest, and PokéPark Entrance Plaza, which will feature a Research Lab where you start your adventure. It remains opaque exactly how the whole thing will work, but you seem to be given a choice between a Bulbasaur, Charmander or Squirtle (“No Timothy, Pikachu wasn’t one of the original starters! Stop that crying!”), and then you’re off to explore the various areas. The Pokémon Center will apparently feature Chansey and allow you to heal your Pokémon (which itself implies a lot), while the Mart seems to be primarily a refreshment area. Beyond that, there’s an Eevee-themed carousel and something called Pika Pika Paradise powered by 30 Pikachu. These both require separate ticket purchases! Meanwhile, the Gym will be used for live performances. Which seems a shame, given the chance to offer a bunch of challenges for kids to complete, right? And some of these live shows require their own separate tickets too!

Let’s hope it’s completely brilliant, and given that it’s being added to such an established and popular park, and created by The Pokémon Company itself, it really should be. But please can we have more of this super-weird marketing before any of that happens?

item.title: DJI Mic Mini Bundle Is Going for Peanuts, Likely to Sell Out at This All-Time Low Price Before Black Friday Hits
item.content:encoded:
If you’re creating content for TikTok, Instagram Reels, or YouTube Shorts, there’s one simple upgrade that can dramatically improve the quality of your videos: invest in a good microphone. It might sound minor, but clear, professional audio can make the difference between a clip that feels polished and one that viewers scroll past. Many creators focus heavily on lighting, cameras, and editing but overlook how crucial sound is. Even if your audience doesn’t consciously notice poor audio, they’ll feel that something’s off—and it can make your content seem less professional overall. The truth is, nine times out of ten, the issue isn’t your camera or setup; it’s your sound.

Fortunately, fixing that doesn’t require a big budget. Right now, the DJI Mic Mini two-person vlog bundle is 41% off, bringing the price down from $169 to just $99. That’s a $70 savings for a serious boost in quality.

See at Amazon

Always Reliable Audio

These compact wireless microphones are designed for creators who want great sound without bulky gear. Each mic weighs just 10 grams, making them ultra-light and discreet on camera. They clip on easily, look clean in your shots, and are comfortable to wear even during long recording sessions. Despite their small size, they deliver impressively rich, clear sound.

One of the standout features is their maximum transmission range of 400 meters. That’s nearly a quarter mile. You can move freely while recording without worrying about losing signal or sound quality. Whether you’re filming casual vlogs, outdoor interviews, or travel content, this kind of range means flexibility and freedom of movement.

The DJI Mic Mini system is built to handle noisy environments. Each mic includes pro-level noise cancellation with two adjustable intensity modes. The “Basic” setting is perfect for quiet indoor recordings, while “Strong” mode helps cut through background chatter or city noise when filming outside. Plus, an automatic volume limiter prevents distortion if the audio input spikes too high. That feature alone can save you a lot of frustration during post-production. No more clipped or unusable takes.

Another great perk is compatibility. The DJI Mic Minis integrate smoothly with the DJI Osmo Audio ecosystem, pairing seamlessly with devices like the Osmo Action 5 Pro without needing a separate receiver. It’s plug-and-play simplicity, designed with creators in mind.

Battery life is pretty great. Each transmitter and receiver can operate for up to 10 hours on a single charge, so you can record interviews, live streams, or full-day shoots without worrying about running out of juice. Combined with the included charging case, you can expect to have a total of 48 hours of life on a single charge.

item.title: Forget Mac Mini, Dell Intel Core Ultra 5 Slim Desktop Hits Its Lowest Price Ahead of Black Friday

Grabbing a fast, efficient desktop right now doesn’t have to break the bank. Thanks to Early Black Friday Day Deal, you can score one without overspending.

Right now, the Dell Slim Desktop ECS1250 is available for $600 on Amazon, down $150 from its original price. If you’ve been looking to upgrade your work setup for less, this is the right time to make the move. Since the sale event wraps up tonight, you’ve only got a few hours left to make the decision.

See at Amazon

Made for Everyday Use

It’s a tower computer, but without the bulk and noise of traditional options. It runs on an Intel Core Ultra 5-225 processor that is great for everyday tasks like browsing, streaming, work projects, plus some light creative work. There’s 16GB of DDR5 memory to keep everything running smoothly, even when you’re trying to be productive with a whole bunch of apps opened at the same time. It’s basically built for small workspaces, and Windows 11 support means better overall efficiency.

You’re also getting a 512GB M.2 SSD that takes care of both the boot times and storage. This is enough space to house all your favorite apps, documents, and even a bunch of media content, like some movies for when you’re on the road. Expect the system to load fast, and the programs to open without the usual lag. Ports are also plenty to connect all the essentials and then some. This desktop supports up to four Full HD monitors using DisplayPort 1.4a with daisy chaining, or two 4K displays with the HDMI 2.1 and DisplayPort combo.

It’s also built keeping your future needs in mind. The side panel is tool-less and removable, which means you can open it to upgrade components like storage whenever needed. Even better, there’s a hardware TPM security chip for encrypted data protection, and a lock slot for physical security. This is great if you’re going to use it in a shared office space.

Overall, this desktop is ideal for smaller workspaces. If you’re just looking for something that delivers good, reliable performance for your everyday tasks, this machine is an excellent option to consider. The RAM and storage are great on their own, but it also supports future upgrades when needed. This deal brings the price down to $600, but won’t be around for too long.

item.title: The Super Mario Galaxy Movie Direct Will Probably Reveal If Yoshi Talks Or Not
item.content:encoded:
Nintendo is airing a Super Mario Galaxy Movie Direct this week. It will include the upcoming sequel’s first full trailer. I’m on the edge of my seat wondering how it will deal with Yoshi.

The livestream will be available Wednesday, November 12, at 9:00 a.m. ET for the special Nintendo Direct. “Please note that no game information will be included in this presentation,” the company cautioned. Still, that gives us the rest of the day to wrap our minds around whichever new stars have been cast to bring the latest trip back to the Mushroom Kingdom to life.

Most importantly, the trailer will likely reveal what Illumination and Nintendo have decided to do with Yoshi’s voice. The green dinosaur was teased at the end of the first Mario Bros. Movie with an egg breaking open in the sewers beneath Brooklyn, and has since been all but confirmed via promotional imagery for cookie dough.

But Yoshi is not like most Mario Bros. characters. He’s not humanoid and doesn’t talk in the games. He just shouts “Yoshi!” in an adorable buttercream voice that just melts your heart. That seems like the most obvious approach for the Mario Galaxy Movie, which will seemingly have something to do with the titular plumber and pals exploring new worlds in the stars.

The alternative is that Yoshi talks and sounds human. Despite the horror, that seems like a non-zero possibility. I’m imagining something like Idris Elba’s version of Knuckles in the Sonic movies: a completely earnest delivery in a vaguely cockney accent that is at once both completely bizarre and yet somehow fitting. I would love for Nintendo and Illumination to really go for something wild here.

Give us Nicholas Cage in the role of a lifetime. Even if it’s just him screaming “Yoshi!” every five minutes.

item.title: Apple AirPods 4 Suddenly Drop to Almost Free, Early Black Friday Strategy or Just a Clearance Move?
item.content:encoded:
We’re still a couple weeks shy of Black Friday and Cyber Monday. While you can expect to find lots of deals over that late-November weekend across consumer tech and pretty every every other category of products, that doesn’t mean you can’t find any lucrative deals right now. The Apple AirPods 4 are just over a year old and are now seeing a pretty significant discount. It’s a great time to pick up a pair if you’ve been holding out. The base model of Apple’s versatile earbuds released at the price of $129. Right now, Amazon has them for 34% off, brining the price to just $85. You’ll end up saving yourself a good $44. If you want to upgrade to the model with support for active noise cancellation, you can expect a 16% discount. That pair normally goes for $179, but the deal ends up shaving off $30 so you only have to pay $149 for a limited time.

AirPods have been around for a while now with Apple adding in some incremental improvements with each generation. The latest version in the Apple AirPods 4 feature a refined contour with a shorter stem and quick-press controls for music. Apple put a lot of focus on all-day comfort this time around.

See at Amazon

Isolate Sound

You can expect better sound quality when it comes to calls all thanks to the new H2 chipset Apple designed. The new chip enables voice isolation to remove background noises. Folks on the other end of the call will be hearing you and only you, even if you’re in a crowded, noisy environment. The AirPods are able to eliminate sounds coming from around you so you come across perfectly clear.

Likewise, you can expect to better audio quality on your end because of the H2 chip. the new acoustic architecture is designed for crystal clear highs and deep bass.

A nice little addition to the AirPods feature set is how the buds interact with Apple’s voice assistant. Sire can now interpret basic gestures such as nodding yes or shaking your head no as a response to question. Not sure which seems weirder though for someone sitting across from you on the subway. You doing that, or you just blankly saying “Yes” or “No” allowed to no one in particular.

Something you can see different between the AirPods 4 and the previous model right away in a side-by-side is Apple has finally done away with the proprietary Lightning port. The case for the AirPods now charge using the now standard USB-C which is a welcome change indeed.

See at Amazon
